com.w2.api.engine.components.sensors

Class Microphone

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w2.api.engine.components.sensors.Microphone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotComponent, RobotSensor

    public class Microphone
extends java.lang.Object
implements RobotSensor
    Created by sudhir on 11/26/14. / /** The `Microphone` object provides detected sound data from `Robot` (read-only).

    `Robot` will try to detect sound from a two-dimensional plane and returns the calculated amplitude. If sound is loud enough, `Robot` will also triangulate the direction where the sound is coming from and return it as triangulationAngle in radians.
    If the sound amplitude is too low to be detected, then triangulationAngle will return ANGLE_UNDEFINED.

    • Method Detail

      • getAmplitude

        public double getAmplitude()
        Get Amplitude
        Returns:
        Amplitude calculated through sound sampling, which reflects the loudness of the sound. Returns values from [RobotComponentConstants.VOLUME_MUTE, RobotComponentConstants.VOLUME_MAX].

      • getTriangulationAngle

        public double getTriangulationAngle()
        Get Triangulation Angle
        Returns:
        Direction angle (in radians) where the sound originates, from the point of view of the robot. Returns values from [-PI, PI]. If the sound amplitude is too low to be detected, returns 'ANGLE_UNDEFINED'

               throws JSONException
